featured_reviews.review_id: First of all I ordered a 10-piece McNuggets and two were missing. Then my chicken sandwich was incredibly dry. That says a lot about the place. Then when I went to grab my drink in the fountain and there was no lids or straws. I asked a staff member and he either didn't want to help or didn't know the workplace at all. He was turning around looking for lids and told me "I don't think we have lids anymore". Turned around a bit more and then found lids just from the back counter. Bad service, bad food, and the guy preparing the order doesn't know how to count to 10. Don't come to this location.

featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely ridiculous behaviour from the staff. It's 9:20pm. I ordered online ahead of time as I was coming in car from home to eat in. Had to go to washroom first as I have some health issues and needed to wash my hands before I eat. As normally ppl should. Staff didn't want to let me in with an excuse that the maintenance is in progress. No one was doing maintenance they just simply decided to close to the washroom for the night. This kind of behaviour should be illegal as it is a restaurant and restaurant bylaw says clearly you need to provide washroom when ppl eat in. Hope they will not behave like this towards anyone else in the future. Managers name that night was Jenny. Hope the top management will sort this out. I will visit again to see if the behaviour towards customers improved. Then will revisit my review.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Expensive location -- 30c to $1 more expensive for most items.  Go to the Kingsway/Victoria location if you can, it's a bit cheaper.

On top of being one of the most expensive locations in the city this one's also one of the worst.  They clear off all orders from their pick up screen making for a confused, full lobby of everyone asking if their order is up.  Use the system as it's meant to be and things would be a lot clearer and run more smoothly!

Somehow, this location also has the worst McIced coffee ever.

featured_reviews.review_id: It's probably the worst McDonald's in the city. Pulls everyone and clears orders before they have been completed. This causes congestion in the parking lot, slower service, and lost orders. Ironically, this is to cheat the system and make their corperate overloards think they have good drive-thru times. But realistically, you're looking at a 15-minute average wait time for any order.

featured_reviews.review_id: This has to be the worst McDonald's I've been to. This is not a one-time deal; they're the nearest McDonald's and as a busy student on a budget I end up here once in a while. No matter what time of day, even if they aren't busy, you'll end up getting parked to wait for your food when going through drive thru, even for a small, basic order, and sometimes end up sitting for upwards of 10 minutes. "Fast food", woo! There's never any greeting at the drive thru mic, you drive up and sit there waiting for several minutes without so much as a "hello" or "be right with you". Today, I received two "sausage" egg McMuffins with no sausage on either. Great... to summarize: terrible, slow, inaccurate, impolite and no end in sight. Not to mention their nightmare of a parking lot.

featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely the greatest McDonalds I've ever been to. I'm visiting from Ontario, and let me say that I've never had a McDonalds with the level of ambiance and service that I had here. First thing is first, this place is well maintained, from the lawn outside to the tables inside. The washroom is spotless.  The service is amazing, and staff are on and everything, making sure everything is done efficiently and amazing. I had the quarter pounder and fries, and it was the best McDonald's meal I ever had. The meat was absolutely flavor country. I'm glad I stopped in here.

Yes it's McDonald's and it's not healthy but I don't need grease dripping all over me while I'm trying to eat.

featured_reviews.review_id: Horrible service here. I ordered 20 nuggets, 3 honey sauce, spicy habanero sauce, quarter pounder with NO onions and EXTRA pickles, and a medium root beer. First of all my friends and I have to wait nearly 40 minutes for our order and when I kept asking them whether or not they're making it the staff kept saying they were working on it but we wouldn't get our food. Then I find out that they gave SOMEONE ELSE our order without double checking the other person's receipt on whether or not it was the correct order. Then after asking them 5 times to make ours they only give us 17 nuggets, 2 honey sauce, spicy habanero sauce, and did not take out the onions from the burger. Also did not receive our root beer and the staff would just ignore us when we would ask politely. My friend is deathly allergic to onions too so she wasn't able to have her burger. I understand it was crowded but that is no way to go about our order. Horrible customer service and I'm very disappointed by this location. They also refused us a refund for not giving us our full order. Terrible place and I will never come back here.

featured_reviews.review_id:
McDonald's hamburger from Canada is legit. It was juicy, flavorful, and was 100% umami beef flavor. This was a nice surprise!

The floor was very dirty with food wrappers, napkins, and cups on the floor all over the place. This was also a surprise, but not nice.

There was no ice in the drink machine and no napkins available.

The staff was slow and the service was minimal.

Sara, Chevy, Joban and Zoey are all my morning time baristas. I get anywhere from 3 to 5 cups of coffee a day and they are always helpful.

I'll keep coming back and getting my delicious large caramel lattes as long as they keep serving them! Thank you McDonald's and staff for having fast and friendly service!

See you tomorrow am (of course)..

Also I want to mention that the management is very professional and always looks out for me I'd like to include Sara in this great review!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Obviously McDonald's isn't known for being lavished, amazing 5 star food. I've ordered chicken nuggets from there twice now and both times they've come so stale and gross I can't even eat them. This last time I got their food there was also MOLD on my fries! Unacceptable, no matter what restaurant you're running.

On top of that, they also state they are open 24 hours, yet they shut their indoor dining down at 6pm most days and only allow mobile ordering which is extremely frustrating if someone wants to use cash or for elderly people who are not as experienced in technology but would still like something to eat.

Overall, no matter how desperate you get, go elsewhere. You won't regret not spending your money here.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Good location, very tiny McDonald's. Strange smell all the time at exactly this location. Coming to all chain quite often and no noticeable smell, but this place has specific smell. Service friendly and supportive, thanks to the staff. Automatic order Machine working fine, order TV screen working as supposed to be.
I think if you're comparing to Alberta all McDonald's in BC working great - I'm still shocked.
If you'll find source of smell and reduce it, big improvement guaranteed. Good place for getting your fast food.
pc: for those using app, large iced coffee offer is just 1$.

featured_reviews.review_id: Small cafe, very pleasant service, quickly ordered coffee and chicken hamburger, muffins. It's very tasty and positive. The downsides are dirty tables and floors, a lot of garbage and an overflowing trash can right next to the tables, which was not very pleasant. We wiped our own table and sat for quite a long time. At the end of our meeting, workers came and removed everything from the trash can. We may have stopped by during their lunch hour, let's try again. But the kitchen itself was clean and the workers were in clean clothes. We'll come back again, maybe it will be cleaner. In any case, thank you, there was nothing stopping us from sitting and talking over coffee.

It's McDonald's. For when you don't have time to get out of the car and you're okay on spending money on food that is utterly predictable and forgettable, it's one of your only options in this world. Sometimes as a bonus, it will trigger a childhood memory, good or bad.

Anyway, it hasn't killed me yet, so that's something.

This particular McDonald's is not a drive thru, so there's almost no reason to go to it.

And the washrooms are out of order most of the time.

featured_reviews.review_id:
During my recent visit to McDonald's in Vancouver, I had a mixed experience encompassing both positive and negative aspects. Here's a balanced review highlighting the key points:

Positive:
Menu Variety - McDonald's offers a diverse menu with plenty of options. Whether it was classic favourites or new additions, there were choices to suit different preferences and dietary restrictions.

Negative:
Slow Service - This particular McDonald's service could have been faster. It took longer than expected to place my order and receive my food. Improved efficiency during peak hours would enhance the overall dining experience.

Negative:
Atmosphere Concerns - The atmosphere of the restaurant fell short of expectations. The seating area appeared unclean, and the floors were scattered with food and drink spills. This lack of cleanliness created an unhealthy and uninviting environment.

Positive:
Familiarity and Convenience - McDonald's consistency in its menu and service can be comforting for customers seeking a familiar dining experience. Additionally, its convenient locations make it easily accessible for a quick meal.

In conclusion, my visit to McDonald's in Vancouver had ups and downs. While the menu variety and familiarity were positive, the slow service and cleanliness issues detracted from the overall experience. I hope the management takes note of these concerns and takes steps to improve service efficiency and maintain a cleaner and more inviting environment for customers.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Understaffed for how busy it is, and paid almost 10$ for a 6$ breakfast, just cuz I wanted hot chocolate in my coffee, and lettuce and tomato on my sandwich. And apparently 'regular' lettuce at this McDonald's is one half wilted leaf..

They were nice enough to provide me with proper lettuce after I complained, but there should really be some baseline standards.

Lotta people complaining about the homeless, but they mostly don't bother you if you don't bother them. Might get one asking you for spare change on your way in/out, but that's no diff than anywhere else in Vancouver. It's an issue with our society, not this McDonald's. But they do need to focus on food quality.

featured_reviews.review_id: This place is always HORRIBLY busy.  I chose to walk in but I regret, there were about 30 people starring at the order monitor but there were no order number at all.  After close to 40 minutes waiting for my 2 meals with 2 fries no salt, end up I got salt all over my hand and the food I got was cold.  Asked to change the hot fries with no salt and complained I had been waiting for my food over 30 mins.  The manager gave an attitude, "it is not my problem, we were busy", I said "so is that my problem? you are the manager on duty and not responsible the human power?"  She turned around and shout "it's not my problem, give her something hot".  I am patience enough to wait more than 30 mins for FAST FOOD and I deserve to receive this kind of "Customer service"????  The manager was trying to hide when I was taking her picture for evidence.  And other manager on duty was trying to cover her and asked me am I using human right.  There is nothing to do with human right but I was not treated right.  I brought it up to McDonald Headquarter about the incident I experienced at this location and asked for refund coz I threw them away.  The headquarter told me this restaurant manager would contact me within 10 business days but I never receive any phone call or email.  I received 2 meal coupons from Headquarter as a refund.  I will never ever come back again.  P.S. This restaurant is always full of garbage everywhere and no one was doing cleaning.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I worked here after high school during the 1980's for six years until Expo 86. Ah, the memories. Now I eat here and it's a totally different environment. The restaurant is smaller and the service isn't what it use to be. I had to wait 5 minutes before a crew noticed me standing at the counter. They have to look up often, not at their food station.
The drink station needs a wipe and the floors are sticky. The tables needs clearing and wiped. And floors swept of dropped fries. My whole time eating there not a single time a lot & lobby person checked.
I'll still come back at another time to eat to check if there's any improvements.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My fries were cold, the burger was cold and wasn't even assembled well, the patty was halfway on the bun. I can see if it were late at night or busy or understaffed but it was quiet, with at least four staff around 7pm. I don't expect much from fast food but when I'm paying $16 for 2 burgers, fries and a coke I expect it to at least be hot. And ketchup would have been nice considering I specifically asked for it. Worst McDonald's I've been to in a very long time.

*Edit
I have since returned to this McDonald's and have had a much better experience. Maybe that one visit was just an off day or maybe there was a change in management. Whatever the reason, I hate to pigeon hole a place based on 1 visit. I will eat here again as it's close to home, and let you all know how it goes. Upgrading from 1 to 3 stars.

Edit* I ordered a cone which immediately fell apart all over my hands. She grabbed a cup and put it in there and thought that was sufficient. I asked for a new one. She disappeared for a minute anf gave me the same cone in a cup and said it was new. I'm done with this McDonald's. 0 stars

featured_reviews.review_id:
Online Ordering Beware!
Hands down the worst order I've ever received from any McDonald's location, *so far*.

I'm not kidding either, do yourself a favor and don't order takeout delivery from this location. Period. The picture I took of my poutine order should already say it all.

If you want further context, read below:

I ordered a poutine from this location through UberEats. There were no issues with the delivery itself. Opening up my poutine box, I discovered one shoddy, thin layer of gravy on a few hardened, bland fries.
If I had to recount, it only had around 10~ individual fries. To make it worse, it arrived at room temperature, despite how I got my order delivered relatively quickly. (McDonald's location is within 1.5 kilometers away from my location.) In the end, I did get my refund from UberEats (thankfully). Sufficient to say I will not be ordering at this location again...

Every time I order a root beer in the drive-thru, I forget to check it and the syrup is always out. They'll still serve it, but it's always out. Fortunately I checked before leaving the parking lot this time, which means I'm also remembering to review it.

It would honestly be better for them to remove root beer as an option altogether rather than to continue to rip people off. Last thing I'm thinking about when I'm getting 'fast food' is whether or not the staff is doing something as simple as changing the syrup... I'm, beginning to think they're intentionally cutting corners.

Last thing I'm thinking about when I'm getting 'fast food' is whether or not the staff is doing something as simple as changing the syrup... I'm, beginning to think they're intentionally cutting corners.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Slow clap for this location

Food is typical for McDonald's.

Service, we'll this location is horrible, everytime I come here I get told to park and wait for my order. A fry burger and a pop. How sad it is that they cannot have enough food ready to go. I understand that demand is higher at certain times but 25 minutes from order to getting food is ridiculous. And when you refuse to be parked you get even worse service because now you are going against the normal, it's a drive thru and I should have to pull over and wait. While I sat and waited for my order 6 to 7 vehicles were parked so they can make their time for drive thru.  Truly terrible management for thinking this is acceptable to treat customers like this.

After receiving my order my fry level is laughable. Ordered junior McChicken extra mayo and received my mcchicken with no mayo

How do you mess that up.
Completely unacceptable.

Corporate McDonald's needs to review this location and it's management for customer service and drive thru operations.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This was a laughably bad experience. Came here at about 5:00 in the morning so it wasn't very busy. I simply ordered six chocolate cookies. I went inside and stood at the counter and waited for my order. There's no lineu, there's only one order on the order screen, which was mine. There's nobody at the till, there's a couple cooks in the back mopping and a lady up front mopping. After a few minutes the lady up front sees me and then tells the cooks that there's an order up. The cooks say something I couldn't understandand and disappear around the corner. I assume that they're going to finish baking my cookies. Fresh baked cookies, yay, I mean why else would I be waiting around this long for six cookies? They were in the oven baking. No doubt.

But they weren't. They weren't in the oven baking. After about 7 or 8 minutes another young lady comes out from, I guess the break room, and asked if I've been helped. I'm like "yeah I placed an order a while ago." She looks at the till and then reaches under the counter and grabs me six cookies and hands them to me. And, oh yeah, they weren't chocolate cookies either, they ran out. They were the chocolate chip ones. So I wait around for almost 10 minutes for six cookies, and they weren't even the right ones. The complacency at this McDonald's was unreal. I have to laugh honestly it was so bad it was comical. The girl who came in at the end who actually got me the cookies I will say, was doing her job correctly as far as I can tell..

I decided to get cookies here because I was picking up an Uber eats order. Except they told me I had to cancel the order because the customer ordered things from the evening menu and it was now on the breakfast menu. So I had to text the customer and let them know I can't pick up her order because they can't make it and I'll have to cancel. And I canceled. My question is why does this McDonald's have items on their Uber menu that customers can't order? Every McDonald's I've ordered from will have either breakfast items on the menu or their lunch and evening items on the menu. Fix your Uber menu. This is crazy to me also how someone can be on break and literally know other employee in the restaurant looks at orders or prepares orders. Like don't you have a protocol for like, you know, knowing when orders come in? And getting the customers their food?

Was ignored by several employees. Finally got the attention of one of them and was treated poorly as if I was lying. 20+ minutes for two items is ridiculous. This place needs new management immediately as it clearly shows the staff they have now were not trained properly and cannot handle the work load (wasn't busy at all). You go to McDonald's and don't really expect top notch service etc but this was baffling.

places.address: Burger King, 821 Granville St, Vancouver, BC V6Z 1K9

featured_reviews.review_id:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this Burger King yet. This place is legendary. If you're a super posh person who can't handle the real world, this Burger King isn't for you. That said, all kinds of people frequent this Burger King. Of course there are individuals, I know someone who got ripped off by an individual in this Burger King. There are also regular working people, office people, young people, and tourists. Usually they always have posters up for items that sold out long ago. They have a really large menu with a lot of customizability. I always found the staff to be nice and patient with me, even though I have yet to memorize the Burger King menu, and always need to read it when I get to the front. When you're standing at the front waiting for your food, it feels really tense, like a contest, because some things take forever, and you could get your food way earlier or way later than you expect.

Not just anybody can use the bathrooms, they would be too prone to abuse in a location like this, the bathrooms are for paying customers only. No shenanigans.

I like the music they play in here, it's always pleasant. Generally '70s music with a leaning towards soul.

The Angry Whopper is dope, I like that, I get it with no cheese because I'm lactose intolerant. I want to try and see if they have any spicy chicken tenders or nuggets.

This is a lively and fun establishment.

To be honest, I like to go to Jollibee first and order a two piece chicken, eat that, and then smuggle the Jollibee gravy in my pocket and use it for the Burger King fries. I haven't gotten banned yet.

I usually go during off hours in the afternoons, and there are a lot of individuals. Right now I'm here at lunch and it is very orderly and normal. Kind of disappointing, really.

Everyone was working hard even the cashier looked drained. orders were coming out quickly, staff were friendly and helpful and someone was out in the dining room keeping things clean (I really appreciated that). Of course my order took longer then most because I had to get something that took time to do but no complaints from me. I was impressed because the last time I was there was a long time ago and its was a disaster,  like no one cared. I hope this crew keeps up the great work, it's alot of hard work and not an easy job.

Literally people doing drugs at this McDonald's when I was there. They were snorting powder off of the McDonald's table. Staff didn't do anything about it.

I was having a coffee inside the restaurant. After an hour of sitting there, the cleaning lady called security to ask me to leave. They stated that I was staying too long. The restaurant was nearly empty at that time. If they really needed me to leave they could have just asked. I'm pretty sure that cleaning lady couldn't speak English. The security guy just told me that she wanted me to leave so I did.

Very weird experience. Unfortunate that bad experiences like this ruin what is normally an OK place to visit.

featured_reviews.review_id: This morning around 7 AM I ordered MacDonald's breakfast through doordash.  I got my regular order which is a two breakfast burrito meal with coffee, a sausage McMuffin, and I decided to add a smoothie.  I got my order, opened the bag and right away there was no smoothie.  I take out the food and proceed to open up my burritos to add salsa inside.  Right away I noticed that the wrap seems soggy, I open it and the eggs and meat inside look wet.  I take a bite and it tastes fine.  Then I take my first sip of coffee and that tastes off.  I'm hungry so I eat my food.....  Then in around a half hour I start to feel light headed and sick to my stomach.  Then 15-20 minutes later I find myself puking and sitting on the toilet for a while.  It's now 8 hours later and my stomach has still been a mess.  No idea what happened, I've had this same breakfast so many times and it's never done this to me, so I guess I'm posting this to say if it looks or tastes off don't eat the food.

Still I get a big mac several times a month. Just lovin it.
featured_reviews.review_text:
Guys, you know you're bad. It takes forever to get your order. Multiple times I've waited 10+ minutes for a big mac meal. The average wait time had to be between 5-10.

I love McDonald's and I'm thankful there is one in the area and this location IS better than no location but it's a tough spot to get to by foot and by car. It's cramped (not really your fault just the space you were given) in the interior and it seems the 3 tables you do have are always dirty.

Under normal circumstances, it would be a one star but you guys were dealt a bad hand.

I'll pay 10% more for the food if you can get the fast back into the food and keep the tables clean.

Still I get a big mac several times a month. Just lovin it.

featured_reviews.review_id: This is my favourite McDonald's, I always go there around the same time but it has never been busy when I went in there. I always get just a 6 piece nuggets and idk what they do- maybe overcook them a little but I swear to god they are the best nuggets you will ever have in a McDonald's in Vancouver! No sauce required, they are that good. Also the employees are very nice and corteous. One of them even charged my phone for me (which definitely is not in their job description).

featured_reviews.review_id:
I got an ice cream cone. Instead of swirling the ice cream (how it is traditionally done), the manager did a back and forth motion so it was super skinny. I have never been to a McDonalds that has done that. The ice cream was less than half of what it should be (there were big gaps on both sides of the cone where the ice cream should have been).

The manager's tone could be nicer towards her staff. The staff appeared to be scared of her.

On a positive note, the location was clean.

featured_reviews.review_id: Saturday morning, literally 6 staff standing around, more in the kitchen. I ordered on mobile and there had been no move to make my coffee when I came in. A person was actually playing on her phone standing in front of the coffee station. So I guess there was one guy assigned to make the coffee and he was off doing something and needing to get scissors and going back but NO ONE even thought of trying to speed things along by making the coffee. They didn't look like trainees because no one was learning anything. There was a manager on site too! Plus other people in the back and a person sweeping up out front, and yet, no sign of a thought that they could help while there were only a couple of people waiting. Normally it's quite slow to get an order there later in the day but I always figured it was because they were overwhelmed with people and you can see many customers standing around (and at least they are trying and working hard), but in this case, they were not busy. So since no one had started to get the coffee yet, I asked politely if I could get the coffee in my own travel mug please. She answered yes, but with a derisive expression and tone but then didn't take the cup. So found out she was going to pour it in from their disposable cup after and that they don't charge for the cup there (which doesn't matter to me). The other McDonald's I go to has already put up a corporate sign encouraging using your own cup, so I know that while there is a Covid concern, as a company they have already made this change and McDonald's has produced this sign at least a month ago. Anyhow, I said that pouring it in defeats the purpose of trying to reduce waste, so she did bring it over to the area but did not explain it to the ONE GUY that apparently can pour coffee in the place and they still wasted a cup and to really rub it in, he opened up a straw in front of me to stir with completely unnecessarily when they knew I was concerned with waste because I had that conversation with that other woman and she completely couldn't be bothered to pass it on or look after the fact that I had made the request to use my cup directly (no one else was waiting in line). Also, when I told him not to (when I saw him open up the straw package), he continued moving to put it in the coffee even though I was CLEARLY saying no and then I had to really emphasize it, because he just wouldn't stop! SUCH AN UNPLEASANT experience. I am flabbergasted by the lack of any motivation to be competent by this crew. I understand division of labour but this was a huge failure. The other McDonald's that is encouraging travel mugs also gets the entire order done before I even get over to the counter and is friendly and normal, not rude and full of attitude on arrival. At the very least, try to be friendly when you greet someone, especially when they are friendly and happy in the first place, and especially when it was not busy at all! Submitted in the spirit of trying to help because if no one ever said anything, this place would keep having problems.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Grabbed a game day Big Mac deal here. It was freshly made and for $3, a great deal!

I have been to this McDonald's for decades, going back to its original location on Hastings and Alpha. This "newer" location is smaller, but has a more modern atmosphere.

Staff are courteous, efficient, and patient. Drive thru and in-restaurant ordering experiences were always positive.

Parking is plenty, but due to the elongated space, you're a little further away a lot of times.

Food-wise, due to traffic volume, is more often fresh than not. Besides the Still Creek location, I find this location one of the more reliable McDonald's for consistent fresh quality food.

Great spot to pop in if you're hungry for McDonald's!

featured_reviews.review_id: I've live all across the lower mainland. This is now my closest McDonald's and go to. Compared to others, yes needs better management I don't go here often but every time I do it's much slower than others. Last time they told me to park my car for 2 cheeseburgers. I said no its fine. I don't mind waiting here, I said nicely. I rolled up my window and sat there on my phone. They had a long line in drive through. My burgers came within 30 seconds. Lol I hate it I dunno y they make me wait most times for a normal order. I'm not ordering the pizza or anything out of the ordinary. So loophole just hold the line up. featured_reviews.review_id:
entrance is in the front walkway and also in the back parking lot. the back parking lot is dangerous a bit since the drive through cars will be crossing the entrance pathway. there is no way to slow cars from crossing in front of you.

this place is a bit clean and has more space since not a lot of people come. staff kind of showed their frustration a little bit in the front so yeah it kinda of affected the mood of the place.

there is outdoor seating but it's very tight. I'm pregnant so it's not too ideal to weave around the picnic tables even though it was good sun outside.

bought mcflurry kitkat but it wasn't mixed properly at all. it wasn't mixed halfway to the bottom. so that one was sad. and it had a big hole in the middle so i was basically getting half of what i paid for

bought fries as well, nothing new. greasy but that's what fries are unfortunately.

good for a stop over place before heading out to walk at the seawall for sure.

featured_reviews.review_id: This incident did not happen to me, but I was shocked to witness and just wanted to share. On Sunday Aug 13th around 7:30pm, I went to this location to get an ice cream. The young lady before me had purchased 4 large size ice coffee and the coffees were placed onto a very soft, poor quality paper tray. Due to the heavy weight, the tray broke in half and the 4 coffees spilled on the ground. The young lady asked the manager if she could get a replacement and have someone to clean up the floor. However....the manager said back to her "can you get the mop from the washroom and clean it up yourself?" The young lady was stunned and overwhelmed that the manager actually told her to go clean up the mess. The manager continues to say that "in here, whoever makes the mess gotta clean up themselves." The young lady was also shocked and said " excuse me, but what?" Seeing the customer unsatisfied, the manager said "okay, you can clean it up and I will tell someone (a worker) to help you."  This left me speech, I have never seen customer service like this anywhere else. This is West Van, I just think this location has ruined the reputation/face of park royal.

featured_reviews.review_id:
There's typically enough parking available. The upstairs seating area offers plenty of space, making it a great spot for families or groups. The food quality consistently meets my expectations, and the service is reliable. The availability of kiosks is a convenient touch, especially during busy hours.

However, there are some downsides to consider. The downstairs seating area is quite limited, which can be a drawback during crowded periods. It's also worth noting that the upstairs area may close at night, limiting your options for seating. Lastly, be prepared for potential wait times, as occasionally, there can be delays in receiving your order.

In summary, this McDonald's location is a dependable choice with a few minor inconveniences. If you value parking availability, good food, and a variety of seating options, it's worth a visit, just be mindful of potential wait times and seating restrictions.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Upon my recent venture to the illustrious McDonald's establishment, I regrettably encountered a rather disheartening breakfast burrito experience. Alas, the concoction laid before me was a woeful symphony of excessive eggs, leaving the paltry meat to cower in the shadows. Moreover, perplexingly, the establishment boasted a ladies' lavatory while forsaking the gentlemen's sanctuary, a peculiar oversight indeed.

To exacerbate matters, a stringent 30-minute consumption decree cast a gloomy pall over the proceedings, ostensibly to curtail loitering. While one appreciates a prompt and efficient visit, the imposition of such a constraint marred the otherwise indulgent repast.

Alas, my lamentation does not end there, for the custodians of this establishment demonstrated a regrettable deficiency in the art of hospitality. Customer service, once the cornerstone of culinary endeavors, was but a fleeting wisp of an ideal here, leaving patrons feeling disheartened and undervalued.

featured_reviews.review_id: Horrible wait time! Been there a few times and the drive thru is always busy. Decided to use pick up this time. As you can see, the "reserved" pick up spots were all parked, with no one inside their cars. I supposed there wasn't sufficient parking? Entered the closest stall number and waited for more than 5 mins, and no one came out with my order. So I decided to go in and grabbed my order. Waited for too long so I had to leave right away. Ordered no ice on all my drinks and guess what... THEY ALL HAD ICE! Just look how much ice there are. There's enough to sink the Titanic again.

featured_reviews.review_id:
We are working on a jobsite nearby, occasionally stop for coffee or breakfast in the morning, not once has my order been correct.

This morning I ordered a sausage and egg mcgridle, they gave me two of the mcgriddle buns with a jr chicken patty inside.

The employees running the drive thru window are consistently snarky, with the main focus of getting you in and out of the drive-thru as fast as possible, regardless if your order is right.

When I did bring up an issue with the order the one morning, I was told it's my fault she couldn't hear me clear enough, and to speak up next time.

One of the worst McDonald's locations in the metro Vancouver area, and the owner does not care due to the influx of knight street traffic and airport location.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Please remember to check your take-out order before you go!!! I ordered 2 Mighty McMuffins and picked them up at driver-thru. Since it (the bag) seems so light when the staff passed it to me, I parked my car and checked. It was so ridiculous thats nothing inside in both muffins.

I went back to the restaurant and letting them know. They seems didnt believe me and asked "You got it with nothing??". They never apologized for the mistake and just made me other 2 Mighty McMuffins.

featured_reviews.review_id: We ordered one large kiwi pineapple banana smoothie and one medium kiwi pineapple banana smoothie, one large fries and a chocolate sundae. End up the fries is in small to medium amount which only filled half of the fries box! Further The two smoothies that we received were in the same size, the large smoothie was still have more than one centimetre before hitting the cup line near the top. When my son talked to the staff asking him to top up the large cup, he grabbed the two smoothies (one large and one medium size), and pour the smoothie out from the medium cup to the large cup to top up the large smoothie! What kind of attitude is that? We are not beggar who ask for free food but have paid full price for what we are entitled to receive from the merchant! When the staff passed the "adjusted" smoothies back to us, the female staff who was standing next to the Asian young staff who was dealing with our request looked surprised by what the Asian staff had done to the cups. This is a terrible customer service experience that we ever experienced at McDonald's. We will never come here again unless the team manager look into this and take appropriate action to a better training to their team! They need to know what is the proper amount of each food items and know what is a proper and respectful way to deal with their customers!
